page.title: 05Old and New Castle Kennedy
page.content:
The{Old village}originally had 14 houses mainly for Stair Estate workers. There was no electricity, inside toilet or water supply.The water was obtained from a pump which was situated at what is now the Stair Estates Sawmill.There was a shop and sub Post Office run by three spinsters named Patterson.There was also a busy railway station.
The{New village}has 11 private houses and 93 council houses. There is little industry but we have a shop and an estate sawmill. We have no doctor,no policeman and no fire station.They have to come from Stranraer which is 3 miles away. Castle Kennedy School has 52 pupils and 3 teachers.It was built 19 years ago. The main railway line from Stranraer(which links to Belfast) to London runs through the village.
